results.title: Smokers' lungs
results.creator_credit: Don Hopkins, ONF | NFB and Joe Licastro
results.brief_description: No one would inflict external injury to himself—because the consequence is immediately seen and felt. The lungs, however, being out of sight, can be subjected to years of abuse before a smoker takes warning. In this film, Dr. D.W. Thompson of the Toronto General Hospital demonstrates, through a series of color slides of lungs and lung tissue, how the persistent, prolonged irritation of cigarette smoke can bring about drastic, even fatal, changes in the lungs—convincing evidence that smoking can and does cause cancer and other lung disease. A film for the lay audience as well as for use by medical personnel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Hopkins, ONF | NFB and Joe Licastro

results.title: Smoke signal
results.brief_description: Stressing the importance of forest products to Tasmania, this film deals with the causes of forest firest and methods of control. Shows how each township has its own volunteer Rural Fire Organisation, supplemented by the fire-fighting resources of the Forestry Department - cooperation to keep Tasmania green. The main causes of fire are smoldering cigarette butts, camp fires left unattended, and the deliberate burning of dry grass.

results.title: Smoke screen
results.creator_credit: Rainy Day Productions, Michael Warshaw and Mimi Warshaw
results.brief_description: An anti-smoking film, without commentary, which begins with kinestatic, fast-moving stills displaying forty years of cigarette advertising, then moves through a collage of superimposed images of smokers, cancer patients, slogans, tissue slides and surgical flashes.

results.title: Smoke and weather
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and William Greaves
results.brief_description: During the fire season, look-out men keep constant vigilance for the first sign of smoke, scanning the territory for miles around. How they are trained for the work and how their efforts save many valuable stands of timber are illustrated at a fire tower in the Forestry Branch’s Petawawa Forest Experiment Station in Ontario.

results.title: Smoke 'em if you got 'em
results.brief_description: In smouldering post-nuclear devastation, a periscope protruding from the rubble leads to an underground fall-out shelter where a party is raging in celebration of the big meltdown and will continue until the end of the world as we know it. Irreverent, bizarre comedy, starring Nique Needles and Rob Howard.

results.title: Smoke
results.creator_credit: Neue Deutsche Filmgesellschaft, Euro Space, Greg Johnson, Peter Newman and Wayne Wang
results.brief_description: Wayne Wang’s “Smoke” is a beautifully crafted film that weaves together the stories of a group of characters whose lives intersect at Augie Wren’s (Harvery Keitel) cigar shop. Paul Benjamin (William Hurt) is a writer who is trying to recover from the death of his wife. He runs into ‘Rasheed’ who is looking for his father. Meanwhile Ruby McNutt (Stockard Channing) is trying to convince Augie that her heroin addicted daughter is his. Keitel acts as an anchoring force in “Smoke” as the characters’ stories unfold lesuirely and lovingly. (Awards: Winner of the 1995 Berlin Film Festival International Critics Prize and Special Jury Prize)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neue Deutsche Filmgesellschaft, Euro Space, Greg Johnson, Peter Newman and Wayne Wang

results.title: Smithy
results.creator_credit: N.P. Pery, Columbia Pictures and Ken G. Hall
results.brief_description: This biography of pioneering aviator Sir Charles Kingsford Smith was modelled on the Hollywood biopic, and the Cinesound production team’s smooth professionalism matched Hollywood production values. The emphasis is on Smithy’s heroism, and although some conflict is provided by his doubts and domestic problems, the filmmakers seem to be more interested in Smithy’s obsessive quest for perfection. The Pacific flight, the peak of his achievement, rather than his final disappearance, provides an appropriate climax. Smithy’s old plane, the Southern Cross was resurrected from storage and flown by two of its old pilots. The film is also notable for the appearance of former Prime Minister William Morris Hughes as himself. Cast includes Ron Randell as Smithy and Muriel Steinbeck as Lady Kingsford Smith.

results.title: Smiley's people
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Powell, BBC-TV and Simon Langton
results.brief_description: John Le Carre’s character Smiley is bought to life by Sir Alec Guinness in this acclaimed dramatisation. Compulsive viewing to the end, Smiley is called out of retirement to the aid of the Circus. He returns with a vengeance. The assassination of an emigre Soviet and British agent, General Vladimir, sends Smiley delving into the past on a twisted trail across Europe that moves inexorably towards a final showdown with his old adversary and arch-enemy, Karla - leader of Moscow centre.
